title: Police arrest man, 44, on suspicion of murder in Buckinghamshire
text:
Police launched a murder investigation today after the body of a woman in her 40s was discovered at a house in a Buckinghamshire market town.

Thames Valley Police officers were called to the property in Beaconsfield at about 6.15am where they found the woman, who was pronounced dead at the scene.

Officers arrested a 44-year-old man from the town on suspicion of murder and he was taken into police custody. A scene watch was in place at the property today.

Police were called to the property on this road in Beaconsfield, Buckinghamshire (file picture)

Police initially received a 999 call reporting that there had been an incident at the property on Hyde Green, and a forensics team was later drafted into the area.

However, detectives believe the death of the victim - who has not yet been named - was an 'isolated incident' and do not think anyone else was involved.

A Home Office pathologist was expected to carry out a post-mortem examination later, with an inquest anticipated to be opened and adjourned later in the week.

Detective Chief Superintendent Ian Hunter said: 'Detectives from the Major Crime Unit are investigating the circumstances of this incident, and trying to establish exactly how this woman has died.

'We are appealing for anyone who has any information that could assist us to come forward and contact police. I would like to reassure the public that we believe this incident to be contained to the property and isolated.'
description: Thames Valley Police officers were called to the property in Beaconsfield, Buckinghamshire, at about 6.15am today where they found the woman, who was pronounced dead at the scene.
